Game Flow:
  • Assuming you don't lynch or anything first, each day will last two weeks, which is standard for my normal games. You may request a deadline extension, but it is up to my final decision whether or not I grant the extension based on what I've seen. There will not be a lynch if the game goes to night due to this deadline--someone has to consciously place a hammer vote.
  • You may choose to go to night without a lynch before then, by having at least half of the players vote: No Lynch. (That's half, not a full majority.)
  • Votes should be posted in the format 'vote: Barack Obama.' I expect them to be entirely bold, but don't try to exploit this to trick someone. I'll count what I damn well want to count. I will register misspellings and nicknames if I can figure out who you're referring to. You do not have to unvote, but you're welcome to do so anyway.
  • When a player has the majority of the votes at a single point, they are dead and the game goes to twilight. You may post in twilight until I get a lynch scene up.
  • Night deadlines are usually going to be 72-hours, or whenever I receive all actions. If you have a role but don't want to perform a night action, just PM me with the phrase No Night Action so I know you've made your choice.
  • If any anti-town faction does not submit a kill at night, they will no kill and the day phase will continue.
  What is and isn't allowed:
  • Unless otherwise specified, living players can't communicate with each other out of the thread. I will set up a QuickTopic for anyone who is able to communicate with someone else.
  • You may rant to both dead players and nonplaying friends, although you're encouraged to first make sure that said friends aren't interested in replacing in with you. (I am of course available, sympathetic and discrete.) Regardless of where you found them, rantbuddies may not reveal their own opinions on the game.
  • "Dead" means "dead." You can have one "Bah! I'm dead! Go town!" post afterwards, but if it contains any game relevant information, I will delete it, bring you back from the dead, and modkill you just to prove a point.
  • Read your role PM and summarize it in your confirmation PM response to me. Unless I've posted it publicly, you may not reference its wording in-thread. You can paraphrase if you must claim, but any direct quotation of any PMs will result in a modkill. If you are unsure of whether you can say something or not, PM me and ask.
  • Green font and area tags are my domain. Don't use them. Don't pretend to use them.
  • You may only type in default font, italics, bold, underline, etc. Do not increase or decrease default font size, do not change font colors, etc.
  What to expect from me:
  • Do try to be active, and leave a notification in-thread and/or by PM if that's not possible. I will automatically prod anyone who has not posted in over 48 hours. I will make all prods public in the thread.
  • If you don't post in-thread in response to a prod within 24 hours, I will seek a replacement to take over your role. I may seek replacement for a player who lurks consistently without breaking this rule, but you'll have some sort of warning first.
  • If you receive three prods in a row without much contribution to the game, you will automatically be replaced.
  • I'll try to post votecounts regularly. If you feel it has been too long since the last one, request one. If I make errors, please correct me.
  • I'm one of those "spirit-of-the-game"-type hippies. This ruleset is a guideline. I reserve the right to change it at will, and even in extreme circumstances enforce it retroactively. If a strategy feels shady to you, you might want to take it up with me first.
Thanks to Ether for letting me steal her ruleset.

A sample Vanilla Townie role PM reads as follows:
TownieHello, and welcome to Mini 1343: The Death of Papa Zito! It wasn't long ago that Papa Zito, the crotchety old man who always yells at the kids with their damned rap musics and bubble gum, was found stabbed to death. The community wasn't exactly sad to see him go, but the multiple bullet wounds made people wonder just who would go so far as to murder an old, defenseless man! A little scared and bewildered, the town has banded together to out the murderers!

You are a Townie!

Passive Abilities
Obvious Abilities - As a player in the game, you have a voice and a vote during the day phase.

Active Abilities
None

Wincon (Town): You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated.
It is now time to confirm! Please post your confirmations here in this thread, and then wait for me to officially start D1 before posting again.
/confirm
confirming

yes
/confirm

/confirm

/confirm
slash confirm
Confirm

/confirm

OK, perhaps I should explain my vote instead of vaguely alluding to its purpose with esoteric satire.

How do you start a game with a 'mild policy' vote?

There are two reasons to start a game with a policy vote:

1) you genuinely believe that the person you are voting is so terrible that their continued survival will be detrimental to the town regardless of their win condition
2) you want to give the impression that you are doing 1) because you believe this will cause useful discussion

You can't do a mild policy vote. It's pretty much an all or nothing kind of deal. Pine is trying to pretend like he's above the unwashed masses with their uncouth 'RVS lolwagons', while making a vote that's actually even more useless.

This is clearly way better than that silly Amrun wagon, or throwing a dart at the silly Amrun wagon to try to pick out the scum on it.

Mild policy is a thing. Look it up.

I have had strong policy tendencies against asshats like Mist Beauty (now banned) and Deity Kabuto (now banned). People who are merely occasionally unpleasant or obnoxious are in a lesser category. SK is like that. If he's having a good game, he's fine. If he isn't, he's a detriment to whatever side he's on.

Ergo, I default to anti-SK, until he proves he's not going to be a dickhead this game. Don't assign your definitions of commonly-used and variably-defined phrases to other peoples' actions.

Are you familiar with policy lynching? Policy pressuring is essentially the same, but the intention is not to lynch. The intention is to get kdowns to actually help town when I know he is capable of doing so. However, the pressure part comes in if a near majority is willing to put pressure votes on him. At that point, he has the choice of either providing some useful content or being lynched. It's actually a pretty nice system for dealing with crappy play, I think.

And the reason I couldn't just vote him is that the whole thing only works if at least 5 people are willing to do it with me. If I'm the only one that seems to think kdowns needs to step his play up, there is no point in leaving the wagon of my current suspect (Amrun) for someone that I have no read on.

Declaring a vote or voting pattern to be pressure-motivated negates its usefulness.

Stop being useless.
